meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the fireworks did yike the dog.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected thunderstorm yiked the children playing outside.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to yike you when I jumped out from behind the door.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie yiked me so much that I couldn't sleep.
meanings.sent5: The sudden clap of thunder yiked the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A sudden sharp pain or twinge.
meanings.sent1: She felt a yike in her ankle after twisting it on the hike.
meanings.sent2: The yike in his back made him wince in pain.
meanings.sent3: The yike in my tooth reminded me to schedule a dentist appointment.
meanings.sent4: The yike in her side was a sign that she needed to rest.
meanings.sent5: The yike in his knee told him a storm was coming.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or alarm.
meanings.sent1: Yike! I almost dropped my phone!
meanings.sent2: Yike, that was a close call!
meanings.sent3: Yike, I forgot to turn off the stove!
meanings.sent4: Yike! Look at the size of that spider!
meanings.sent5: Yike! Did you see that shooting star?
